channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street Cleaning/Curb, 13th August
item.description:
The issue keeps being put as resolved but I walked the road this morning and it’s not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London

item.title: Various items of litter, appliances and waste, 13th August
item.description:
The whole of the Blenheim-Arpley Estate in Penge has been neglected yet again by the council to sweep ir clear the alleywaysz pathways, and the green spaces around the estate. 2 residents try their best to clear the rubbish weekly, but its too much. It's been several months since the estate saw anyone sweeping or clearing the estate We pay a lot of money for our council tax and we expect our estate to be cleared regularly please. We were told it gets cleared weekly, but we've reported the same problems, the same rubbish on a weekly basis. Whomever is employed to clear the council owned areas, is failing in their duty to clean the area and most certainly does not do it as often as we've been told it is. It's disgusting. Yet again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frant Close, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue, 13th August
item.description:
I noticed recently that all the trees and bushes have been cut back along South Eden Park Road. This is good but I think the litter also needs to be cleaned up at the same time, because there is a lot of it. Cutting back the green merely exposes all the litter, could use a good clean all along from the recycle area to Oakfield Gardens Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Dering Street, Mayfair, London

item.title: Fly tipping and litter, 13th August
item.description:
In and around the new play area of Beckenham Place Park there’s a dumped fridge freezer, broken lime bike, shopping trolley and an incredible amount of litter on the floor - mostly McDonald’s wrappers, food wrappers and drink bottles and cans. 4 or 5 bin bags could be filled within ten minutes easily due to the large amount of litter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Greenway, Southend, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive accumulation of waste on Trederwren road, 13th August
item.description:
Massive amount of garbage and waste has been left behind by the individuals squatting in the Hackney Broadway Offices - Planned Maintenance Department. Includes toilets, household items, rugs, and what appears to be an encampment in the alleyway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Croston Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
